Reports Description

The Global Household Appliances Market was valued at USD 673.2 Billion in 2024 and is expected to reach USD 1115.4 Billion by 2033, at a CAGR of 5.5% during the forecast period 2024 – 2033.

Household appliances refer to electrical or mechanical devices designed for use in homes to perform various tasks, typically related to household chores, cooking, cleaning, or comfort. These appliances are intended to make daily tasks more efficient, convenient, and sometimes even automated.

Household Appliances Market: Growth Factors

Increase in consumer spending power and rising disposable income

The household appliances market experiences growth with an increase in consumer spending power and rising disposable income for several reasons. Higher income levels allow consumers to afford larger purchases, such as major appliances like refrigerators, washing machines, and dishwashers, which they may have postponed due to financial constraints.

Moreover, rising disposable income often leads to lifestyle upgrades, encouraging consumers to invest in more advanced or feature-rich appliances that offer convenience, energy efficiency, or smart capabilities. Additionally, increased purchasing power enables consumers to replace outdated or inefficient appliances with newer models, driving replacement demand in the market.

Overall, as consumers feel more financially secure, they are more willing to invest in household appliances, thereby stimulating growth in the industry and driving innovation and competition among manufacturers. For instance, the survey found that 58% of families experienced increased household spending, signalling a trend towards luxury upgrades among Indian consumers. However, 79% have maintained their consumption levels, showing a cautious stance towards discretionary spending.

Rising traction for smart home appliances drives market growth

The growing traction for smart home appliances is a significant driver of the household appliances market due to several key factors. Increasing integration of smart technology into appliances allows for remote monitoring and control via smartphone apps, providing users with greater convenience and flexibility in managing their homes.

The rise of interconnected devices and smart home ecosystems enables seamless automation and coordination between appliances, enhancing overall efficiency and energy savings. Thirdly, the expanding range of features offered by smart appliances, such as energy efficiency, advanced monitoring capabilities, and personalized settings, appeals to consumers seeking modern, technologically advanced solutions for their households.

Moreover, as the Internet of Things (IoT) continues to evolve, smart appliances are becoming more affordable and accessible to a broader range of consumers, further driving market growth and adoption. For instance, over the past three years, the surge in connected devices has coincided with a doubling in requests made to Alexa for controlling compatible smart home appliances. These include smart lights, plugs, fans, TVs, security cameras, ACs, water heaters, and air purifiers.

Household Appliances Market Restraints

Raw material shortage hinders household appliances market

Raw material shortages can significantly hinder the household appliances market in several ways. Firstly, scarcity or disruptions in the supply chain of key materials such as metals, plastics, and electronic components can lead to production delays and increased manufacturing costs for appliance manufacturers. This, in turn, may result in higher prices for consumers and reduced affordability, dampening demand.

Secondly, limited availability of raw materials may force manufacturers to prioritize certain products or models over others, leading to product shortages and reduced product variety in the market. Additionally, shortages can create a competitive disadvantage for appliance companies, particularly smaller firms with limited access to alternative suppliers or resources.

Moreover, fluctuations in raw material prices due to shortages can destabilize profit margins and financial forecasts, impacting investment decisions and long-term growth strategies within the household appliances industry.

Household Appliances Market Opportunities

Shifting consumers toward eco-friendly & energy-efficient appliances

The shift towards eco-friendly and energy-efficient appliances is driving the household appliances market due to several key factors. Increased environmental awareness among consumers has led to a growing preference for products that minimize their carbon footprint and reduce energy consumption.

Eco-friendly appliances, such as energy-efficient refrigerators, washing machines, and air conditioners, help consumers save on utility bills while also reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Additionally, government regulations and incentives promoting energy efficiency further encourage consumers to opt for eco-friendly appliances.

Manufacturers are responding to this demand by investing in research and development to create innovative, sustainable products that meet both consumer preferences and regulatory standards. Consequently, as environmental concerns continue to grow, the market for eco-friendly and energy-efficient household appliances is expected to expand significantly, driven by consumer demand for sustainability and cost savings.

For instance, Samsung offers an extensive selection of home appliance brands encompassing TVs, refrigerators, washing machines, and more. Notably, one series of their washing machines has been honoured with the Appliance of the Year award at the National Energy Conservation Awards.

Household Appliances Market Segmentation Analysis

Household Appliances market is segmented by type, distribution channel, and region. Based on type, the market is classified into refrigerators, air conditioners & heaters, entertainment appliances, washing machines, microwaves & ovens and others.

Refrigerators dominated the market in 2022 with a market share of 35% and are expected to keep their dominance during the forecast period 2024-2032. Refrigerators play a pivotal role in driving the household appliances market for several reasons. Firstly, they are essential for preserving perishable food items, thereby ensuring food safety and reducing waste.

As consumers become more health-conscious and seek to minimize food expenses, the demand for refrigerators grows. Additionally, technological advancements, such as energy-efficient models and smart features like temperature control and monitoring, attract consumers looking to save on utility bills and enhance convenience. Moreover, changing lifestyles, including busier schedules and smaller living spaces in urban areas, increase the need for compact yet efficient refrigeration solutions.

Furthermore, the rise of smart homes and integration with other connected devices further boosts the appeal of refrigerators. Overall, the continuous innovation, coupled with evolving consumer preferences and lifestyle trends, drives the growth and expansion of the household appliances market, with refrigerators at its forefront.

Based on distribution channel, the market is classified into supermarket & hypermarket, specialty stores, e-commerce and others. Specialty stores segment dominated the market in 2022 with a market share of 45% and is expected to keep its dominance during the forecast period 2024-2032.

Specialty stores play a crucial role in driving the household appliances market due to several key factors. Firstly, these stores offer a wide range of products, including niche and specialized appliances that may not be readily available in general retail outlets. This variety caters to specific consumer needs and preferences, allowing customers to find appliances tailored to their requirements.

Specialty stores often provide expert advice and personalized customer service, enhancing the shopping experience. Knowledgeable staff can guide consumers in selecting the most suitable appliances based on factors such as size, features, energy efficiency, and budget, thus fostering trust and loyalty. Moreover, specialty stores often showcase the latest innovations and trends in household appliances, attracting tech-savvy consumers seeking cutting-edge products.

Additionally, specialty stores may offer exclusive deals, promotions, or bundled packages, incentivizing consumers to make purchases. These strategies not only boost sales but also create a sense of exclusivity and value for customers. Overall, specialty stores play a pivotal role in driving the household appliances market by offering diverse product selections, expert guidance, innovation, and value-added services, ultimately enhancing consumer satisfaction and market growth.

Household Appliances Market Regional Analysis

By region, Household Appliances market is segmented into North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Latin America, Middle East & Africa. The Asia-Pacific dominated the global Household Appliances market in 2022 with a market share of 45% in 2022 and is expected to keep its dominance during the forecast period 2024-2032.

The Asia-Pacific region serves as a significant driver of the household appliances market due to several factors. Rapid urbanization and rising disposable incomes in countries like China, India, and Southeast Asian nations have led to an increase in household formation and demand for modern amenities, including household appliances.

This demographic shift creates a substantial consumer base for various appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, air conditioners, and kitchen appliances.

Moreover, the region’s large population, coupled with changing lifestyles and preferences, fuels the demand for innovative and technologically advanced appliances. Manufacturers often tailor products to meet specific regional requirements and preferences, further driving market growth.

Furthermore, government initiatives promoting energy efficiency and sustainable living contribute to the adoption of eco-friendly appliances across the region. Incentives and regulations aimed at reducing energy consumption and environmental impact encourage consumers to upgrade to newer, more efficient models.

Household Appliances Market Recent Developments

In April 2023, Midea Group Co. planned to acquire Electrolux to compete in North America and Europe markets in a consumer base for various appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, air conditioners, and kitchen appliances.

In April 2022, Panasonic was honored with the prestigious iF DESIGN AWARD 2022 for 21 of its products, spanning a range including shavers, washing machines, televisions, cameras, headphones, and more. These accolades were achieved through the approval of the 132-member jury, consisting of independent experts from various global locations.

In February 2023, LG introduced a lineup of AI Dual Inverter air conditioners featuring advanced technology. These air conditioners, powered by AI, are equipped with multiple built-in sensors and a superior dual rotary compressor for optimal cooling performance.

Report Methodology

In order to get the most precise estimates and forecasts possible, Custom Market Insights applies a detailed and adaptive research methodology centered on reducing deviations. For segregating and assessing quantitative aspects of the market, the company uses a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches. Furthermore, data triangulation, which examines the market from three different aspects, is a recurring theme in all of our research reports. The following are critical components of the methodology used in all of our studies:

Preliminary Data Mining

On a broad scale, raw market information is retrieved and compiled. Data is constantly screened to make sure that only substantiated and verified sources are taken into account. Furthermore, data is mined from a plethora of reports in our archive and also a number of reputed & reliable paid databases. To gain a detailed understanding of the business, it is necessary to know the entire product life cycle and to facilitate this, we gather data from different suppliers, distributors, and buyers.

Surveys, technological conferences, and trade magazines are used to identify technical issues and trends. Technical data is also gathered from the standpoint of intellectual property, with a focus on freedom of movement and white space. The dynamics of the industry in terms of drivers, restraints, and valuation trends are also gathered. As a result, the content created contains a diverse range of original data, which is then cross-validated and verified with published sources.

Statistical Model

Simulation models are used to generate our business estimates and forecasts. For each study, a one-of-a-kind model is created. Data gathered for market dynamics, the digital landscape, development services, and valuation patterns are fed into the prototype and analyzed concurrently. These factors are compared, and their effect over the projected timeline is quantified using correlation, regression, and statistical modeling. Market forecasting is accomplished through the use of a combination of economic techniques, technical analysis, industry experience, and domain knowledge.

Short-term forecasting is typically done with econometric models, while long-term forecasting is done with technological market models. These are based on a synthesis of the technological environment, legal frameworks, economic outlook, and business regulations. Bottom-up market evaluation is favored, with crucial regional markets reviewed as distinct entities and data integration to acquire worldwide estimates. This is essential for gaining a thorough knowledge of the industry and ensuring that errors are kept to a minimum.

Some of the variables taken into account for forecasting are as follows:

• Industry drivers and constraints, as well as their current and projected impact

• The raw material case, as well as supply-versus-price trends

• Current volume and projected volume growth through 2032

We allocate weights to these variables and use weighted average analysis to determine the estimated market growth rate.

Primary Validation

This is the final step in our report’s estimating and forecasting process. Extensive primary interviews are carried out, both in-person and over the phone, to validate our findings and the assumptions that led to them.

Leading companies from across the supply chain, including suppliers, technology companies, subject matter experts, and buyers, use techniques like interviewing to ensure a comprehensive and non-biased overview of the business. These interviews are conducted all over the world, with the help of local staff and translators, to overcome language barriers.

Primary interviews not only aid with data validation, but also offer additional important insight into the industry, existing business scenario, and future projections, thereby improving the quality of our reports.

All of our estimates and forecasts are validated through extensive research work with key industry participants (KIPs), which typically include:

• Market leaders

• Suppliers of raw materials

• Suppliers of raw materials

• Buyers.

The following are the primary research objectives:

• To ensure the accuracy and acceptability of our data.

• Gaining an understanding of the current market and future projections.
